author: Christopher M. Matthews
title: Halliburton Warns of Earnings Hit Due to Delays in Sand Delivery
text:
Halliburton Co. warned Thursday that its first-quarter earnings would take a hit due to delays on delivery of a key ingredient used to hydraulically fracture shale wells: sand.
Trading in shares of the oil-field services giant was briefly halted Thursday morning before Chris Weber, Halliburtonâ€™s chief financial officer, said the company expected an impact of 10 cents per share on its first-quarter earnings due to delays by Canadian rail companies that would slow sand delivery.
...
